tips.rules: Craft Clear Questions: Ensure your poll questions are clear and concise. Ambiguity can lead to misinterpretation and skew results.
Opt for Timelessness in Topics: When appropriate, create polls without deadlines. Timeless polls can continuously gather opinions, providing ongoing insights and broader participation.
Allow Collaborative polls when necessary if your poll is open ended

Specify Target Demographics: If your poll is intended for a specific demographic, clearly state this in the question. Set necessary criteria to ensure only the targeted demographic participates for accurate results.

Leverage Date Filters: For open-ended polls, use date filters to analyze results within specific timeframes. This is especially useful for making decisions by a certain date while keeping the poll active for future insights.
Encourage Constructive Opinions: If your poll allows for comments or additional opinions, encourage participants to provide constructive feedback that enhances the discussion.
Use Visual Aids: Incorporate images or charts when relevant. Visual aids can make your poll more engaging and help convey information clearly.
Promote Polls Effectively: Share your poll across different platforms to reach a wider audience. Effective promotion leads to greater participation and diverse viewpoints.
Analyze Trends Over Time: For polls without deadlines, regularly analyze the trends and shifts in opinions over time. This can provide valuable insights into changing perspectives
Respect Privacy and Consent: Ensure your polls respect user privacy,
